Function

statement.p: Identify each term above, or give an example, for this situation: At time t seconds, the height of a basketball above the ground, h, in feet, is given by ~~h=-16t^2+20t+5.

ol.li: h is a function of t.
The function value for t=1 is h=9.

subsection.title: 2. Solve linear equations and inequalities with parentheses

ol.li: Simplify each side of the equation: apply the distributive law, combine like terms.
Use addition and subtraction to get all the variable terms on one side of the equation, and all constsnt terms on the other side.
Divide both sides by the coefficient of the variable.

solution.me: \begin{aligned}[t] 3(2a-4) \amp \ge 4-(1-3a) \amp \amp \blert{\text{Apply the distributive law.}}\\ 6a-12 \amp \ge 4-1+3a \amp \amp \blert{\text{Simplify the right side.}}\\ 6a-12 \amp \ge 3+3a \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract}~ 3a~ \text{from both sides.}}\\ 3a-12 \amp \ge 3 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Add 12 to both sides.}}\\ 3a \amp \ge 15 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 3.}}\\ a \amp \ge 5 \amp \amp \end{aligned}

\begin{aligned}[t] 25-6x \amp =3x-2(4-x) \amp \amp \blert{\text{Apply the distributive law.}}\\ 25-6x \amp =3x-8+2x \amp \amp \blert{\text{Combine like terms.}}\\ 25-6x \amp =5x-8 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract}~ 5x~ \text{from both sides.}}\\ 25-11x \amp =-8 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Subtract 25 from both sides.}}\\ -11x \amp =-33 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by -11.}}\\ x \amp=3 \amp \amp \end{aligned}

solution.p: If the variable is in the denominator of a fraction, we must first clear the fraction. \begin{aligned}[t] \alert{y}(\dfrac{15}{y}) \amp = 45 \cdot \alert{y} \amp \amp \blert{\text{Multiply both sides by} ~y.}\\ 15 \amp = 45y \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 45.}}\\ y \amp =\dfrac{15}{45}=\dfrac{1}{3} \amp \amp \end{aligned}

To "undo" a square root, we square both sides of the equation. First, we isolate the square root. \begin{aligned}[t] \dfrac{5 \sqrt{t}}{\alert{5}} \amp = \dfrac{83}{\alert{5}} \amp \amp \blert{\text{Divide both sides by 5.}}\\ (\sqrt{t})^2 \amp =(16.6)^2 \amp \amp \blert{\text{Square both sides.}}\\ t \amp =275.56 \amp \amp \end{aligned}

statement.p:
Here are some MISTAKES to avoid.
x^3 \cdot x^5 \not= x^{15}
(2x^3) \not= 2x^3
(x+2)^3 \not= x^3+8
2 \cdot 5^3 \not= 10^3

Each "simplification" is INCORRECT. Write a correct version.
(3+b^3)^2 \rightarrow 9+b^6
5a^3+3a^2 \rightarrow 8a^5
(4x^4)^2 \rightarrow 16x^{16}
\dfrac{w^3}{w^9} \rightarrow -w^3
